chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
l: list nat

Goal:
Forall prime l -> 1 <= lprod l

Premises:
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, q <d p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
Forall : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Notation lprod := (fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1)
lmax_spec : forall (l : list nat) (x : nat), lmax l <= x < -> Forall (fun y : nat => y <= x) l
list_max_le : forall (l : list nat) (n : nat), list_max l <= n < -> Forall (fun k : nat => k <= n) l
Forall_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> Prop), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
Forall_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> SProp), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l
Forall_and : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall Q l -> Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l
List.Forall_impl : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall a : A, P a -> Q a) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> Forall Q l
Forall_and_inv : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l -> Forall P l /\ Forall Q l
ForallOrdPairs_sind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l
ForallOrdPairs_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ForallOrdPairs R l -> P l
prime_ge_2 : forall p : nat, prime p -> 2 <= p
Forall_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (Q : list A -> Type), Q nil -> (forall (b : A) (l : list A), P b -> Q (b :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> Q l
prime_gcd : forall p q : nat, prime p -> is_gcd p q 1 \/ p <d q
list_max_lt : forall (l : list nat) (n : nat), l <> nil -> list_max l < n < -> Forall (fun k : nat => k < n) l
List.Forall_rev : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall P (rev l)
Forall_forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> (forall x : A, In x l -> P x)
map_ext_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => f x = g x) l -> map f l = map g l
nat_list_insert_Forall : forall (P : nat -> Prop) (x : nat) (l : list nat), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (nat_list_insert x l)
FOP_cons : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (a : A) (l : list A), Forall (R a) l -> ForallOrdPairs R l -> ForallOrdPairs R (a :: l)
Forall_inv_tail : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (a : A) (l : list A), Forall P (a :: l) -> Forall P l
Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l)
no_common_prime_is_coprime : forall x y : nat, x <> 0 -> (forall p : nat, prime p -> p <d x -> p <d y -> False) -> is_gcd x y 1
natr_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N * Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N)) (l : list nat), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) eq BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l lH -> forall lmp : list (BinNums.N * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol BinNums.N), Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list BinNums.N0 (BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH) BinNat.N.add BinNat.N.mul BinNat.N.add (fun x : BinNums.N => x) BinNat.N.eqb BinNat.N.div_eucl lH = lmp -> forall (pe : Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N) (npe : Ring_polynom.Pol BinNums.N),...
Forall_fold_right : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> fold_right (fun x : A => and (P x)) True l
prime_factor : forall n : nat, 2 <= n -> {p : nat | prime p /\ p <d n}
natr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list nat) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N * Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr BinNums.N), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) eq BinNat.N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l lpe -> (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list BinNums.N0 (BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH) BinNat.N.add BinNat.N.mul BinNat.N.add (fun x : BinNums.N => x) BinNat.N.eqb BinNat.N.div_eucl lpe in Ring_polynom.Peq BinNat.N.eqb (Ring_polynom.norm_subst BinNums.N0 (BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH) BinNat...
neg_Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> ~ Forall P l -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l
list_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Type), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
Exists_Forall_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, P x \/ ~ P x) -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Forall P l
exists_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (P : A -> B -> Prop) (l : list B), (exists k : A, Forall (P k) l) -> Forall (fun x : B => exists k : A, P k x) l
